name: system/Timer

a0ac32d7-eef7-4f43-96d5-17815979d4e9.name: start
a0ac32d7-eef7-4f43-96d5-17815979d4e9.description:
Receives the timerId which identifies the timer.

Example:
"timer1"

97976e7b-b852-4140-b047-35db148ae936.name: stop
97976e7b-b852-4140-b047-35db148ae936.description:
Receives the timerId which identifies the timer to be stopped.


Example:
"timer1"

99754d65-be80-4a0a-9597-498a1f214bb0.name: delay
99754d65-be80-4a0a-9597-498a1f214bb0.description:
Receives the time in milliseconds that the timer should wait before the `done` port is triggered.

Example: 
300

23a5647a-8b13-46d6-8d3f-8700f611f8cd.name: done
23a5647a-8b13-46d6-8d3f-8700f611f8cd.description:
Sends timerId when the delayed timeout is reached.

Example:
"timer1"

08d3f754-31c4-4baa-a02d-125a556da397.name: stopped
08d3f754-31c4-4baa-a02d-125a556da397.description:
Sends timerId when the timer is stopped.

Example:
"timer1"

description:
Sets a timer which triggers `done` port after as many milliseconds as received or specified by `delay.  Timer can be canceled with Ë™stop` (input).

Examples:
1. "timer1"@0 received via `start`
2. 300@0 received via `delay`
3. after 300 ms "timer1"@0 sent via `done`

1. "timer1"@0 received via `start`
2. `delay` set to 300
3.. "timer1"@0 received via `stop`
4. "timer1"@0 sent via `stopped`
